DataElement.preferredName: Hepatitis B Infection Preventive Intervention Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator related to whether hepatitis B prophylaxis was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hepatitis B Infection Preventive Intervention Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus._Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A viral hepatitis caused by the Hepatitis B virus.

Concepts.definition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.

Property.preferredDefinition: In medicine, action taken to decrease the chance of getting a disease or condition. For example, cancer prevention includes avoiding risk factors (such as smoking, obesity, lack of exercise, and radiation exposure) and increasing protective factors (such as getting regular physical activity, staying at a healthy weight, and having a healthy diet).:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The indicator related to the patient receiving hepatitis B prophylaxis.

PermissibleValues.value: No, hepatitis B prophylaxis indicated per protocol (positive for HBV core Ab and/or surface Ag) but did not receive
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No Hepatitis B Virus Preventive Intervention Specified From Protocol Negation Receive

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Hepatitis B Virus Preventive Intervention Specified From Protocol Negation Receive
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.: In medicine, action taken to decrease the chance of getting a disease or condition. For example, cancer prevention includes avoiding risk factors (such as smoking, obesity, lack of exercise, and radiation exposure) and increasing protective factors (such as getting regular physical activity, staying at a healthy weight, and having a healthy diet).: Clearly and explicitly stated.: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.
Clearly and explicitly stated.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

PermissibleValues.value: No, HBV prophylaxis not indicated per protocol (negative for HBV core Ab and surface Ag)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No Hepatitis B Virus Preventive Intervention Negation Specified From Protocol

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Hepatitis B Virus Preventive Intervention Negation Specified From Protocol

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Clearly and explicitly stated.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Active immunization where vaccine is administered for therapeutic or preventive purposes. This can include administration of immunopotentiating agents such as BCG vaccine and Corynebacterium parvum as well as biological response modifiers such as interferons, interleukins, and colony-stimulating factors in order to directly stimulate the immune system.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
